newsitem.title: GERMANY: Coalition members to attend Kohl, Lafontaine talks.
newsitem.headline: Coalition members to attend Kohl, Lafontaine talks.

text.p: German Chancellor Helmut Kohl and Social Democrat (SPD) party boss Oskar Lafontaine will be joined at their meeting on tax reform by leading members of Kohl's centre-right coalition, official said on Friday.
"The Chancellor may invite whoever he wants to accompany him," SPD parliamentary leader Rudolf Sharping told Germany's SAT1 television.
The SPD at the weekend sought to split the coalition of Kohl's Christian Democrats (CDU) and junior partner liberal Free Democrats (FDP) by suggesting a meeting between the CDU and SPD alone.

The proposal was immediately dismissed and coalition sources said that party and parliamentary leaders from the government coalition parties would attend the meeting that now has been scheduled for February 24, according to the SPD.
The SPD would send Lafontaine, Sharping and Henning Voscherau, Hamburg mayor and coordinator the SPD fiscal policy issues.
The SPD earlier said that Kohl and Lafontaine had agreed early on Friday to hold a meeting to discuss the government's tax reform plan.
